title: Calories in a Green Apple
meta_description: Discover calories in a green apple, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per medium fruit.
assumptions: Medium-sized green apple (e.g., Granny Smith, ~182 g with skin and core removed, raw, unpeeled).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, size, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels or apps for specific produce.

quick_answer.text: One medium green apple provides ~95 kcal and ~4.4 g fiber.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in a green apple?
faqs.a: About 95 kcal for one medium green apple.

faqs.q: Are green apples lower in calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar—both ~95 kcal per medium apple; green may have slightly less sugar.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in a green apple?
faqs.a: Approximately 4.4 g per medium apple, mostly from the skin.

faqs.q: Do green apples have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Very low: 0.3 g fat and 0.5 g protein per apple.

faqs.q: How does apple size affect calories?
faqs.a: Small (~129 g) ≈68 kcal; large (~223 g) ≈116 kcal—scale by weight.
